SEARCH

Class ImageTransformer

java.lang.Object
ImageTransformer
public class ImageTransformer extends Object
The ImageTransformer class implements a set of methods for performing transformations (split, join, and red removal) in a specified image.

  • Constructor Summary

  • Method Details

    • splitImage

      public static BufferedImage[][] splitImage(BufferedImage image, int nRows, int nColumns)
      Splits a given image in sub-images according to the number of rows and columns specified in the arguments.
      Parameters:
      image - the BufferedImage containing the image
      nRows - the number of rows to split the image
      nColumns - the number of columns to split the image
      Returns:
      a BufferedImage array containing the sub-images

    • removeReds

      public static BufferedImage removeReds(BufferedImage image)
      Removes the red component of a given image.
      Parameters:
      image - the BufferedImage containing the image
      Returns:
      a BufferedImage without the red component

    • joinImages

      public static BufferedImage joinImages(BufferedImage[][] splitImages, int width, int height, int type)
      Joins a given array of BufferedImage in one final image. This method should be called after splitting the images using, for example, the method splitImage(BufferedImage, int, int).
      Parameters:
      splitImages - the BufferedImage array containing the sub-images
      width - the width of the final image
      height - the height of the final image
      type - the type of the final image
      Returns:
      a BufferedImage array containing the image joined

    • createImageFromBytes

      public static BufferedImage createImageFromBytes(byte[] imageData)
      Creates a Buffered image from a byte array
      Parameters:
      imageData - - Byte array of with the image
      Returns:
      - Image as a BufferedItem object

    • createBytesFromImage

      public static byte[] createBytesFromImage(BufferedImage image)
      Serializes an image as a byte array so it can be sent through a socket. It is important to define the type of image
      Parameters:
      image - - image to be converted as a byte[]
      Returns:
      - image as an array of bytes
